abnormal_findings.abnormality: Possible renal cysts (indicated by arrows in the images)
Possible renal mass or other abnormality (indicated by arrowheads in the images)

Diagnosis: Possible renal cysts and/or renal mass. Further investigation is required to determine the exact nature of the findings.
Medical Suggestions: Further evaluation is needed to characterize the renal findings.
Consultation with a nephrologist or urologist is recommended.
Treatment: The treatment will depend on the diagnosis after further evaluation.
If renal cysts are confirmed and asymptomatic, observation may be sufficient.
If a renal mass is suspected, further imaging (e.g., CT scan with contrast) and/or biopsy may be necessary to determine if it is benign or malignant.
Treatment options for renal masses may include surgery, ablation, or active surveillance, depending on the size, location, and characteristics of the mass.
